qas.question: When did Audio CDs become available for purchase?
What were CD's originally created to store?
In what year were compact discs realesed for purchase?
What was the original intended format for CDs?
What year were CDs changed so that they could store data?
What does ROM in CD-ROM stand for?
Which was released first; CD-R or CD-RW?

context: <a1_0><b7_0>Compact Disc<b7_0/><a1_0/> (CD) is a digital optical disc <a5_0>data storage<a5_0/> format. The format was originally developed to store and play only <a2_0>sound recordings<a2_0/> but was later adapted for storage of data (CD-ROM). Several other formats were further derived from these, including write-once audio and data storage (<b8_0>CD-R<b8_0/>), rewritable media (CD-RW), Video Compact Disc (VCD), <a3_0>Super Video Compact Disc<a3_0/> (SVCD), Photo CD, PictureCD, CD-i, and Enhanced Music CD. <b10_0>Audio CDs<b10_0/> and audio CD players have been <b9_0>commercially available since October <a0_0><a4_0><b6_0>1982<b9_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/>.
